quiz.title: Economics: Supply and Demand Shifts, Elasticity, Substitutes

questions.question: If a market is initially in equilibrium and supply is a vertical line, what happens when the downward-sloping demand curve shifts to the right?
questions.explanation: A vertical supply curve means quantity supplied is fixed. A rightward shift in demand increases price, but quantity remains unchanged.

questions.question: If demand is inelastic, an increase in price will:
questions.explanation: When demand is inelastic, the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is less than the percentage increase in price, so total revenue (price × quantity) rises.

questions.question: Which of the following pairs of commodities is an example of substitutes?
questions.explanation: Substitutes are goods that can replace each other in consumption. Tea and coffee are classic substitutes.

questions.question: Which of the following is an assumption of the law of demand?
options: Price of the commodity should not change
Prices of substitutes should not change
questions.explanation: The law of demand holds ceteris paribus—other factors like prices of related goods (substitutes and complements) are assumed constant.
